Test-Spell.name: Test Spell
description: You cast "Test" upon yourself in order to ensure you are still an arcane caster.

Biting-Hoarfrost.name: Biting Hoarfrost
Biting-Hoarfrost.materialComponent: a handful of snow or chalk dust
description: You blow the white powder from your hand, turning your breath into a chilling blast of arctic wind.

@%Each creature%@ in a @%30-foot cone%@ must make a @%Constitution%@ saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes @%2d6 cold damage%@ and is @%restrained%@ in ice. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not restrained.
To break out, the restrained target can use its action to make a @%Strength check%@ against your spell save DC. On a success, the target escapes and is no longer restrained by the ice.
@+At Higher Levels.+@ When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the size of the cone increases by 10 feet and the cold damage increases by 1d6 for each slot above 2nd.

Sheet-of-Ice.name: Sheet of Ice
Sheet-of-Ice.materialComponent: a twig once frozen completely in ice
description: You create a 3-inch-thick sheet of ice on a @%solid surface%@ within range, or spanning @%two solid anchor%@ points within range. You may choose to make the ice sheet up to @%20 feet long%@ and @%20 feet wide%@.
When the sheet of ice appears, each creature within its area must make a @%Dexterity%@ saving throw. On a failed save, is knocked @%prone%@.

The first time a creature attempts to move across an effected area of the ice sheet during a turn or ends its turn there, the creature must make a @%Dexterity%@ saving throw. On a failed save, it is knocked @%prone%@.

If the sheet of ice is suspended between two anchor points, it can hold up to @%150 lbs%@ of weight before shattering. The sheet of ice has an AC of 12 and 10 hit points, and is @%vulnerable%@ to fire damage.
